headline: CNN Special Reports
subHeadline: Assault on Democracy, The Roots of Trump's Insurrection. Aired 11p-12a ET

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Multiple Capitol entries, multiple Capitol entries.

utterances.speaker: DREW GRIFFIN, CNN SENIOR INVESTIGATIVE CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: An assault on democracy, an attack on the Capitol, fueled by a president's lies.DONALD TRUMP, FORMER U.S. PRESIDENT:  This election was stolen.

utterances.speaker: JOHN BOLTON, FORMER NATIONAL SECURITY ADVISER TO PRESIDENT TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Trump wanted the crowd to turn into a mob.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Inspired by a delusion and enraged mob of true believers attempting insurrection.

utterances.speaker: MICHAEL FANONE, CNN LAW ENFORCEMENT ANALYST
utterances.sentences: We were in a medieval battle.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Trump's soldiers.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: There is a sea of nothing but red, white and blue patriots and Trump.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Trump's true believers.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: I feel like he was anointed by God.YVONNE ST. CY, CHARGED IN CAPITOL RIOT:  I don't think Joe Biden is the president.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: New exclusive interviews.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: The sound surrounded us. But then once they started banging on the door, that's all I heard.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: New details.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Overran the Capitol.JOANN ROW, DONOVAN CROWL'S MOTHER:  I never dreamed that he would ever do anything like that. GRIFFIN:  New denials. You call January 6, a peaceful protest?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I do.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: And why it's not over.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: In fact, it is just getting started.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Tonight, a CNN Special Report, Assault on Democracy, The Roots of Trump's Insurrection.The early morning of January 6, 2021 started for many as a day of anticipation. They had come from across the country, tens of thousands Americans from all walks of life led by a lying president and egged on by propaganda, they would converge on the United States Capitol with a singular goal, do whatever it takes to prevent the peaceful transition of power in the greatest democracy on Earth. President Donald J. Trump lost the election. They were deceived into believing the presidency had been stolen. Their country was threatened. They had come to Washington to fight for what they thought was right. CYNTHIA MILLER-IDRISS, DIRECTOR, POLARIZATION & EXTENSION LAB, AMERICAN UNIVERSITY:  They feel they're the heroic, revolutionary, courageous, warriors who are saving democracy.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: But they were wrong. It was all a lie. January 6th was insurrection disguised as patriotism wrapped in a Trump flag, a lie fed to them from their president, their members of Congress, their T.V. and radio shows, their friends on social media.

utterances.speaker: IMRAN AHMED, CEO, CENTER FOR COUNTERING DIGITAL HATE
utterances.sentences: It should have been predictable. You know, we saw people who'd been whipped up into believing an election was being stolen. And then they were being told it's going to happen straightaway. So, you've got both radicalization and mobilization. That's the perfect recipe for acts of violent extremism.

utterances.speaker: CYR
utterances.sentences: I hate that I've lost so many friends and I hate that my family thinks I'm crazy. And I hate that it's such a struggle. And I hate that people don't see the truth. Welcome to communist America. Aren't you so fucking proud?

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Yvonne St. Cyr, 54, from Idaho facing two federal charges, filmed herself inside the Capitol. The former Marine and mom began her twisted path through this protest with weight loss surgery and a documentary about the food industry.

utterances.speaker: CYR
utterances.sentences: They lied to us about what they put in our food and what's acceptable and not acceptable.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: That path to better nutrition would lead to QAnon.

utterances.speaker: CYR
utterances.sentences: I believe that this is truly the great awakening. This is bigger than Q, this is biblical. I believe that the corrupt systems are the anti-Christ. They're all corrupt, and they're all part of the same evil. I believe we're living out the Book of Revelation.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: She stormed the Capitol, live streamed her protest and is now unrepentant.

utterances.speaker: CYR
utterances.sentences: I don't believe Joe Biden is the President. And I believe that he lost the election and that they tried to steal it and that Trump did what he needed to do. He needed to step away to wake America up.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Josh Pruitt, a bodybuilder and bartender from the D.C. area, came to the Capitol because he too believed the election was stolen from Donald Trump.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: If Biden had won, if at 10 o'clock at night, they would have announced Biden won nobody would care. We really don't care that much. We care that much because we thought we were cheated.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Your idea of this election has been batted down by courts, by Republican election officials, by secretaries of state, from every single state that this was a fair election?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: All you can say is 85 million Americans feel differently than what you're saying right now, guaranteed. The election was stolen. It just was.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: There's untold reams of proof that it wasn't.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: There's absolute proof that there was but nobody wants to show it and everybody wants to hide it.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Where's the proof of that?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: There just is.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: His journey was more convoluted.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I voted for Obama. I liked Obama.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: He is now a Proud Boy. A video of him being initiated into the far right extremist group went viral.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I'm a Western chauvinist.I got 30 million views, I think. I'm a Proud Boy.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: And gain thousands of followers on social media.On January 6th, video would capture him again in the first wave of rioters storming the Capitol.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: We didn't storm any capitol, okay? We did protest. We peacefully protested.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: You call January 6 a peaceful protest?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I do.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: You don't feel any responsibility?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I do not, absolutely not. I don't feel I did anything wrong.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Donovan Crowl, a member of the extremist group, the Oath Keepers, was in a column of the right-wing militia marching into the Capitol. He refused to speak to CNN. His sister and mother describe him as an ex-Marine who went from being a little league coach to becoming an alcoholic.DENISSA CROWL, DONOVAN CROWL'S SISTER:  He was just a genuinely good person. He was always someone that I looked up to, and that I was extremely proud of.

utterances.speaker: ROWE
utterances.sentences: His son idolized Damon. Everybody idolized him because he had a great personality.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Crowl's life would spiral downward after his second marriage fell apart. His mom battling leukemia says he was a mean drunk.

utterances.speaker: ROWE
utterances.sentences: He just is Dr. Jekyll, Mr. Hyde when he's drinking.

utterances.speaker: CROWL
utterances.sentences: It's all kind of snowballed. Then he started going on these websites that essentially were a vacuum.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: He would move to rural Ohio and find companionship from a transgender bar owner and militia leader named Jessica Watkins, who would recruit Crowl into a militia, the Oath Keepers.

utterances.speaker: ROWE
utterances.sentences: He found a purpose in his life because he was at rock bottom. And anybody that cared about him didn't want anything to do with him anymore because of his drinking.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: You consider him a domestic terrorist?

utterances.speaker: ROWE
utterances.sentences: I didn't but I do now.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Couy Griffin was at the Capitol amid thousands on January 6. He climbed a Capitol balcony, borrowed a bullhorn and tried to preach.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: We've been screaming, we've been fighting, but now I want you to pray with me.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: The next day, he would post a much more menacing message about the building's future.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: There's going to be blood routed out of that building.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: The conservative pastor, cowboy and New Mexico county commissioner began his career as a cowboy performer in a Wild West show for Disney Paris. Raised listening to Rush Limbaugh, he saw in President Trump someone who finally understood rural America.He feels the Democratic Party hurt his family business, pushed unfair regulations and didn't take problems at the border seriously. He launched Cowboys for Trump and later rode 170 miles from Western Maryland to Washington, D.C. Griffin appeared on Fox and got noticed by the President himself. It was life changing.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I was nothing but a locally elected county commissioner with massive problems. And the President invited me to sit out at his desk with him and hear me out.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Griffin went to the border with Trump cronies Steve Bannon, and when he posted this video about dead Democrats, President Trump re-tweeted him.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: The only good Democrat is a dead Democrat. I don't say that in the physical sense, and I can already see where the videos getting edited where it says I want to go murder Democrats, no. I say that in the political sense.We're not going to get our election stolen from us from China.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: He sees conspiracies in almost everything. January 6th, it may have been a setup by Democrats. He says he doesn't follow QAnon but it sounds like he shares some of the same beliefs.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: The deep states is just Satan because the devil wants to destroy things.There's those foot soldiers of the deep state, those like Hillary Clinton and George Soros, Dr. Fauci, Bill Gates, you know, they -- they're the big wheels. You know, we're -- they're the controllers. GRIFFIN:  Griffin even doubts the undeniable that the riot led to deaths. Ashli Babbitt, an Air Force Veteran from San Diego, shot and killed by Capitol Hill police. U.S. Capitol Police Officer Brian Sicknick died from a stroke one day after being attacked by rioters. Couy Griffin, like others, cannot accept their so-called peaceful protest led to death, so they deny it.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: So let me just ask you, do you believe Officer Sicknick died because of this riot?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I'm not even so sure that Officer Sicknick is even dead.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Couy.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I'm serious. That's how -- and I hate to be so crazy conspiracy-minded. I'm not even so sure Ashli Babbitt is dead.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Couy.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I mean, who's to say that was it -- have you seen anything of her family?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Up until the point where she passed away, we lived two blocks apart.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: The answer is yes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I mean, I'd say through high school, me and my sister were best friends.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: This is Ashli Babbitt's brother, Roger Witthoeft. He says he and his 35-year-old sister were very close.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: It was weird because we saw it on the news, and it was like, you know, that's my sister.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Witthoeft says his sister was a tomboy, who joined the military out of high school.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: She could do anything. She was invincible. You know, that's the way I looked at her.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: After the Air Force, Ashli Babbitt then bought a pool company in San Diego, which she ran with her husband and her brother.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: She was happy, talked about how she lives in a beautiful place, you know, that's what she wants, it's the American dream.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: And Witthoeft says his sister had voted for Barack Obama.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I think that proves itself she wasn't as crazy as a lot of the media is portraying her out to be.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Then she became a Trump fan.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: We can make America great again.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Ashli's brother said they rarely discuss politics because he just wasn't interested. Her passion for Donald Trump would eventually lead her to QAnon, then the Capitol where a single shot ended her life.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I don't think she deserved to be shot.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: You know what, if I'm going to go down and the anti-Christ is going to take over, I'm going to go down with a fight.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Pastor Ken Peters runs patriot church near Knoxville, Tennessee and preaches Trump's Make America Great Again message.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: So we know something crooked when there's actual evidence.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Peters is a supporter of what's called The Black Robe Regiment, inspired by a group of pastors who fought in the American Revolutionary War.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Oftentimes, these preachers would have their military gear underneath their pastor's robes, and they'd get down with their sermon and they unzipped their pastor's robe and say, now let's go out and fight for independence.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Would you call it a militaristic view towards religion?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: When we talk about warfare, we're talking about spiritual warfare.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Are you ever concerned when you're preaching that there's somebody in the audience who actually takes your words literally?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Not a chance. We aren't attacking anything physically. We are attacking this onslaught of the enemy upon our nation. We believe that this country is being taken over by Satan. We're fighting against demonic forces, not earthly forces.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Peters called on his followers to protest the election results in person on January 6th.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: President Trump has asked every patriot that can possibly be there on January 6 to go D.C., all right? I'm going to be there, God willing.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: And went there himself preaching before a crowd near the White House the day before.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: And it is important that in this moment, we stand up like never before. This is our time. And if we all don't hold up the shield of faith, Satan will take over this land.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: To understand how America got to this, we have to go back to this, November 2008, the election of the first black president.

utterances.speaker: OBAMA
utterances.sentences: Change has come to America.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Change is what the country had voted for, but to some, change brought fear.A right wing media, then led by Rush Limbaugh began to whip its audiences into a collective opposition.

utterances.speaker: RUSH LIMBAUGH, THE RUSH LIMBAUGH SHOW
utterances.sentences: I know what his politics are, I hope he fails.

utterances.speaker: VAN JONES, CNN POLITICAL COMMENTATOR
utterances.sentences: That was a shocking moment when you have the one of the biggest voices in American media, in global media, saying I hope he fails. There were people who let themselves get spooked by the skin color. I think that his name, Barack Hussein Obama, I think there are people that couldn't get past that. He never had a chance.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: It was the beginning of a path that led to Donald Trump's insurrection. New Mexico County Commissioner Couy Griffin listened to Rush Limbaugh every day.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Barack Obama was somebody that I don't feel like I could ever trust.Preachers should be up in the grill of filthy politicians, immoral politicians.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Evangelical preacher, Ken Peters looked at this Christian president and saw a threat to his own religion.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Seeing how pro-Muslim he was versus pro-Christian, I hated how he apologized for America to other nations.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Joann Rowe's son, Donovan Crowl, called Obama racist names. ROWE

utterances.speaker: CROWL
utterances.sentences: He felt that he was going to take his guns. What started it was the Tea Party movement. And then it just grew from there.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: The Tea Party, a political revolution launched in opposition to President Obama's plans to tackle the financial crisis.

utterances.speaker: JIM ACOSTA, CNN ANCHOR AND CHIEF DOMESTIC CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: There was a lot of white rage. Sure, some of the Tea Party activists were out there talking about government spending and so on, but I remember being at tea party rallies seeing t-shirts that said, put the white back in the White House.

utterances.speaker: AMY KREMER, POLITICAL ACTIVIST
utterances.sentences: We are going to fire President Barack Obama.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: A former airline flight attendant named Amy Kremer would use a painted bus, the Tea Party Express, for protests across the country. A decade later, she would be a key organizer of President Trump's rally on January 6th. The Tea Party would capture a new kind of political activism and anger.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: There's a direct link between the Tea Party rebellion and the Trump rebellion, and then ultimately the insurrection.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: In 2011, Donald Trump would capture that same energy of the Tea Party and embrace a conspiracy theory that would launch his own political career, birtherism.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: All I want to do is see this guy's birth certificate.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: That lie that Barack Obama was not born in the United States is as real in the eyes of some of those who stormed the Capitol, as it was a decade ago.

utterances.speaker: CYR
utterances.sentences: It was in the Obama era that something started to stir my soul into politics. I mean, the whole birth certificate thing, there's so much proof he's not a U.S. citizen.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I don't feel like Barack Obama is a believer at America, or what America is and what America stands for.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Do you believe he's American?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Well, yes, you know, I guess I haven't seen his birth certificate of view.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: I think the lesson learned from Trump in that entire saga is that he could get away with a lie.

utterances.speaker: STEVE BANNON, FORMER WHITE HOUSE CHIEF STRATEGIST
utterances.sentences: Lighting a fire that's going to burn all the way to Washington.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Trump's rise was happening at the same time a former investment banker and movie producer named Steve Bannon was building a conservative news site so powerful, it would turn the Republican Party upside down. Named after its founder, Andrew Breitbart, Breitbart News would launch the alt-right into the mainstream.

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: This Tea Party energy, there was this real populist power in this. This was something totally different. This wasn't -- this was not standard Republican Party. And then Breitbart kind of came the blog site for that.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Kurt Bardella, former Breitbart spokesman, says the aim was to change America. And Bannon directed every story on Breitbart's homepage.

utterances.speaker: KURT BARDELLA, FORMER BREITBART SPOKESPERSON
utterances.sentences: Truth, in fact, are not words that are used there. The goal isn't objectivity. It's more about what does the conservative side believe about this and how do they amplify that?

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Breitbart's headlines were built on fear, fear that the Second Amendment was being threatened, fear of Obama, and most of all, fear of illegal immigrants.

utterances.speaker: BARDELLA
utterances.sentences: This is why Bannon and Trump are so perfect together because they both are ultimately perpetuating a massive con. These are people who could give two craps about their base.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Trump had emerged as the perfect candidate to drive Bannon's alt-right visions straight to the White House. And it would be perfectly timed with the rise of social media.

utterances.speaker: CHRISTOPHER WYLIE, CAMBRIDGE ANALYTICA WHISTLEBLOWER
utterances.sentences: Donald Trump would not have become president were it not for Facebook and more broadly, algorithms on social media.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Bannon work with a company skilled in psychological warfare and created Cambridge Analytica that target Americans. Cambridge Analytica Whistleblower Chris Wylie says the delivery weapon used would be Facebook.

utterances.speaker: WYLIE
utterances.sentences: As soon as you start clicking on things, it starts to remove other kinds of content and shows you more and more of that thing that you're clicking on. You start to move further and further away from a common reality with others.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: It was the beginning of a new era of disinformation that continues to tear Americans apart today. Anyone could create a so- called news story and have it spread like wildfire.

utterances.speaker: AHMED
utterances.sentences: I think we have fundamentally misunderstood what happened with social media and the scale of change it has brought about. GRIFFIN

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Facebook is where I got a lot of my media from. Facebook or social media, I feel like you could glean more of the stuff that maybe interests you and isn't coming from a mainstream media outlet.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Social media launched a turning point, deliberate disinformation competes equally with truth and facts, a perfect moment for Donald Trump to launch a presidential bid.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I will build a great, great wall on our southern border and I will have Mexico pay for that wall.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Trump's followers were led to believe American society was under attack, and only Trump could save them. Trump shared more stories from Breitbart than any other source and he would make Steve Bannon the CEO of his campaign.

utterances.speaker: ELIZABETH NEUMANN, FORMER TRUMP DHS COUNTERTERRORISM OFFICIAL
utterances.sentences: He had political advisers that recognized this grievance, figured they could tap into it, amplify it and went off of it.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Completely scare the crap out of white people?

utterances.speaker: NEUMANN
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Just to get elected?

utterances.speaker: NEUMANN
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: It was working. Donald Trump was racing through the Republican primaries, picking up wins and picking up believers.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: I spent a lot of time screaming and yelling during 2016 saying Trump can win. People who were looking only at elite mainstream media didn't see it coming.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Please, for my Trump supporters out there --

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Bartender Josh Pruitt, who says he voted for Obama, was now a Trumper.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I just like the straight to the pointness of him and, you know, his combativeness with people, him not being scared to say stuff.

utterances.speaker: CYR
utterances.sentences: I was so sick of politicians.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Yvonne St. Cyr says she went from supporting Ben Carson to Trump.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Our veterans --

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Pastor Ken Peters would also eventually get on the Trump train.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I was much more for Ted Cruz than I was for Donald Trump. And I knew Hillary or Trump. There's only one choice, it's got to be Trump.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: By 2016, Donovan Crowl is becoming more and more detached from reality.

utterances.speaker: CROWL
utterances.sentences: He wanted me to start collecting water and cash, don't keep my money in the bank.

utterances.speaker: ROWE
utterances.sentences: The really main thing with President Obama was that he was going to declare martial law so he could stay president. He was Trump all the way. But he hasn't voted in his life.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Never voted?

utterances.speaker: ROWE
utterances.sentences: Never voted.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: By November, predictions favored Hillary Clinton by a wide margin. Her campaign had ready to fireworks display for election night, then it happened.

utterances.speaker: WOLF BLITZER, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: Unlike anything we've seen in our lifetime, Donald Trump wins the presidency of the United States.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: He won the presidency. But for Trump, it wasn't enough. Hillary Clinton had beat him in the popular vote. Trump would tweet, she only beat him because of the millions of people who voted illegally. It was a complete lie and it was only the beginning.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I, Donald John Trump, do solemnly swear.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Donald Trump's presidency would begin with a lie.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I get up this one and I turn on one of the networks and they show an empty field. I said, wait a minute. I made a speech. I looked out the field was -- it looked like a million, a million-and-a-half people.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: This was the largest audience to ever witness an inauguration period.

utterances.speaker: BOLTON
utterances.sentences: I think he in his own mind couldn't tell the difference between what was true and what was false. And I don't think it particularly mattered to them.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: John Bolton was Trump's national security adviser.

utterances.speaker: BOLTON
utterances.sentences: If he could convince people that what he wanted to be true was true, he would try to do it.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: And the weeks before he took office, Donald Trump would launch the phrase he would use to get away with almost anything.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: You are fake news.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: With those two words, Donald Trump had told his supporters, they no longer needed nor could trust the institutions, the official accounts, the news outlets that dedicated themselves to present actual facts. From now on, it was Trump who would tell them what to believe.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: A few days ago, I called the fake news the enemy of the people, and they are. They are the enemy of the people.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: He would lie about anything.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: And just remember, what you're seeing and what you're reading is not what's happening.

utterances.speaker: NEUMANN
utterances.sentences: He could have told folks that grass is actually blue and the sky is red, and he would have had some segment of his followers believe him. There is a cult-like phenomenon as it pertains to Trump.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Somebody had to do it. I am the chosen one.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: This might sound extremely strange to a lot of your viewers, but I feel like he was anointed by God. I really do.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Donald Trump anointed by God.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yes, I do. I feel like that he carried God's anointing in there because he won all the time.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: He's an unbelievable leader. And when he speaks he strikes a chord in us. That grabs us. And we go, yes, that's the truth. That's right. Not everything, but most everything he says it grabs us.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Others saw in Trump a rare opportunity to further push an alt-right agenda.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: And yes, by the way, they are trying to take away our history and our heritage. You see that.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Steve Bannon who had hand delivered, Trump's messaging was now ensconced in the White House, turning his worldview into policy.

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: It's not time to bring the country together, it's time to take on the elites in this country, take the torch storm to them, hit them with a blowtorch. GRIFFIN

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: People hate the word, invasion, but that's what it is. It's an invasion of drugs and criminals and people. We have no idea who they are.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Trump followers, we're being fed conspiracy theories by the President on T.V., radio and online.

utterances.speaker: CYR
utterances.sentences: And the migrant caravans, yes, I completely believe they're staged, with all my heart, I do. I mean, there's just too much evidence.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Ashli Babbitt would post video rants about problems on the southern border.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: I live about 15 minutes from the Tijuana border. And so this is something that I really take personally because I can see the effects. They are still trying to paint this migrant caravan as full of women and children, because that's what the media is pushing. But let me tell you right now, the border is an absolute shit show.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I believe that Donald Trump is the only president that we've ever had in office that actually was speaking out to represent us, the forgotten Americans.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Couy Griffin, who would start Cowboys for Trump, would stake his future on the president.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Anybody that lives on the southern border knows that it's extremely dangerous.

utterances.speaker: DAVID AXELROD, CNN SENIOR POLITICAL COMMENTATOR
utterances.sentences: He never thought himself as President of the United States. He thought of himself as the president of his political base. He accentuated their sense of resentment, bitterness of loss.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: This is our town now.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Part of his political base included white supremacists.

utterances.speaker: BOLTON
utterances.sentences: He saw those people as Trump supporters, and he just lacked the ability or the willingness to consider the broader implications.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Kurt Bardella, the former spokesperson for Steve Bannon's Breitbart News, could see the news site attracting more and more racists.

utterances.speaker: BARDELLA
utterances.sentences: The overt racist comments from our audience was littered across their pages. We can proudly proclaim our white pride. And it's okay because the most powerful person in the world is with us right here too.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Joann Rowe could hear it all coming from her basement. Her son, an ex-Marine whom she another family member call an unemployed drunk, was constantly listening to right-wing and conspiracy news, especially the internet show of conspiracy theorist profiteer, Alex Jones.

utterances.speaker: ROWE
utterances.sentences: He would listen to like Breitbart, Alex Jones. He would bring it upstairs full blast.

utterances.speaker: ALEX JONES, HOST, INFOWARS
utterances.sentences: I'd say it's treason and Trump says it's treason, and we're reversing it, period.

utterances.speaker: ROBERT JACOBSON, FORMER INFORWARS EMPLOYEE
utterances.sentences: For the last four years, Alex has been bar none the loudest and most outspoken Donald Trump supporter. And he will tell people what they want to hear when it comes to the conspiracy theory du jour.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Robert Jacobson worked for Alex Jones for more than a decade. He says the conspiracy theories Jones pushed on InfoWars, like mass shootings being fake, were all about making money, which he did by selling questionable health supplements on the InfoWars website. Big stories equal big profits.

utterances.speaker: JACOBSON
utterances.sentences: To Alex, that means that he is going to sell some products that day because of the spike in audience based on somebody else's tragedy.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Jacobson says he doesn't know if Alex Jones believes his own conspiracies. Donovan Crowl's mom and sister say, Crowl believes them all.

utterances.speaker: CROWL
utterances.sentences: He would constantly Facebook message me, sending me stuff about Hollywood pedophiles eating babies. And I'm like, I would just shame them. I mean, that's absolutely ridiculous. I would be like, you're a dumb ass. This is not true.

utterances.speaker: ROWE
utterances.sentences: He would tell us such crazy thing. Hillary Clinton had a sex ring in the basement of a pizza parlor. Tom Hanks and his wife were the head of a pedophile ring.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Your son believed in QAnon basically.

utterances.speaker: ROWE
utterances.sentences: Yes, absolutely.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: A new conspiracy was seeping its way into right wing social media and news outlets, QAnon.DONIE O'SULLIVAN, CNN CORRESPONDENT:  QAnon believe that basically all Democrats are evil, satanic worshiping pedophiles and the only person who can stop all this evil and save the world is Donald Trump. GRIFFIN:  QAnon believer would seek out encoded messages on the internet, parse out numbers and words of Trump's messages, all waiting for some big action from the president. At Trump campaign rallies, Q followers became a noticeable portion of the crowd.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Q is a real thing.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Corruption, child exploitation and sexual abuse, human trafficking.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Like he did with white supremacists, Trump would eventually speak to his Q supporters with a wink and a nod.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I've heard these are people that love our country. So, I don't know really anything about it other than they do, supposedly, like me.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Ashli Babbitt had gone deep into the Q conspiracy, posting QAnon hashtags, including its slogan, where we go one, we go all.ROGER WITTHOEFT, ASHLI BABBITT'S BROTHER:  She had a shirt with a giant We Are Q on it. And no clue what it was and she just said it was some political thing. And that's basically where the conversation ended.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: For Yvonne St. Cyr, Q was much more than political.

utterances.speaker: CYR
utterances.sentences: I really feel like Q just catapulted me to truth because that was my pearl (ph) in the beginning was God show me the truth. I want the truth. Give me truth. I think Trump's a part of Q. He's Q-plus- plus.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: And as the calendar turned on 2020, a global pandemic would take conspiracy theorists down an even darker hole.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: America at war with coronavirus.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: The infection is driving fears of a global recession.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: 75 million Americans have been told to stay home.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Josh Pruitt, a bartender and personal trainer lost work.You don't believe in COVID?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I said I don't believe in it. I don't believe it's that big of a deal. It's pretty ironic that COVID is such a big deal and the flu went away. All of a sudden, there's no such thing as the flu anymore because everybody that had the flu has COVID.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I feel like the coronavirus played a lot into it, on everybody's mental health, not just I don't want to say my sister's because I don't want to say it made her crazy, but it put a lot of stress and strain on everyone's everything.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Protests against business shutdowns broke out at state capitols across the country.

utterances.speaker: CYR
utterances.sentences: So COVID happened and we started the mass mandate, and then things just started to feel wrong. And then they started to have protests. So, I went to my very first protest ever and it was very, very patriotic.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: It was all coming to a head.O'SULLIVAN:  A lot of cool QAnon believers do sort of see this in biblical terms almost.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: A cabal of blood drinking pedophiles, COVID shutdowns trying to destroy the American economy, a conspiracy to replace white people. The election of 2020 would be a battle between good versus evil, and Donald Trump would be ready to tell the biggest lie of all.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Who's not going to at least listen? Well, I mean, he's the president.(COMMERCIAL BREAK)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: There is tremendous vulnerability --

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Years of lies, self-adulation, and the echo chamber of right-wing media --

utterances.speaker: LAURA INGRAHAM, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: Vote by mail is probably the worst way to hold elections.

utterances.speaker: SEAN HANNITY, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: Some completely deny that fraud even exists.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: The only way we're going to lose this election is if the election is rigged. Remember that.It's going to be fraud all over the place.

utterances.speaker: AXELROD
utterances.sentences: Again and again and again, he told people that the election was going to be stolen.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: One of Trump's main complaints, the increased use of mail in ballots overwhelmingly used in 2020 by Democrats setting up a COVID year phenomena called the Red Mirage. In key swing states, the absentee ballots favoring Joe Biden would be counted last.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: You couldn't see Trump go way up and then you can see him plateau and go way down.

utterances.speaker: BLITZER
utterances.sentences: This is CNN's coverage of Election Night in America.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: It is exactly what happened. On Election Night, early results seem to favor President Trump, then turn.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: It has flipped Wisconsin, Joe Biden with a lead right now.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: He would try to stop it.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: Trump has a press conference. It's in the middle of the night. He was trying to essentially declare victory before all the ballots have been counted.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: We were getting ready to win this election. Frankly, we did win this election.We want all voting to stop.

utterances.speaker: DANA BASH, CNN CHIEF POLITICAL CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: That is not what democratically-elected presidents or candidates for the presidency say. That's what authoritarians say.

utterances.speaker: ABBY PHILLIPS, CNN SENIOR POLITICAL CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: He called it a fraud to count ballots in the United States of America?

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Trump had primed the lie, spread the lie, and most of his supporters would only believe the lie.

utterances.speaker: CYR
utterances.sentences: I said, we're going to a bed, and then I woke up and it was like, holy crap, what just happened?

utterances.speaker: PRUITT
utterances.sentences: How are certain seats red, and then at 4

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: It's called counting the votes, though.

utterances.speaker: PRUITT
utterances.sentences: No, it's not. It's called cheating.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: As the election hung in the balance for days, viral videos and fraudulent news stories painted pictures of widespread fraud. It was all a lie.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: In Georgia, look at this new surveillance footage we'll be showing you. A mysterious suitcases potentially fill we believe with ballots, well-rolled out from under a table.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I saw videos where there were suitcases of ballots that were being produced that were all for Joe Biden.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: The mysterious Georgia suitcases that Couy Griffin saw were actually bins of legitimate ballots, election workers doing their job. Like other viral videos, there was no fraud, it didn't matter.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Are you saying that you don't think that there was any fraud at all of this last election?

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: I'm saying that all 50 secretaries of state who are in charge of elections, Republicans and Democrats, found no widespread fraud that could have tilted this election in any way. So, I'm just wondering, where is the fraud?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Whenever you have the president of the United States making those statements.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: This was a massive fraud.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Senator Ted Cruz making those statements as well.SEN. TED CRUZ (R-TX):  And we've seen in the last two months unprecedented allegations of voter fraud.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: They hear a lot more. They are on upper level intelligence briefings. Whenever you have those high ups saying that, yes, there's cheating, what do you do, you know?

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: The ballot counting in key states continue. And on Saturday, November 7th --

utterances.speaker: BLITZER
utterances.sentences: CNN projects Joseph R. Biden Jr. is elected the 46th president of the United States.

utterances.speaker: RUDY GIULIANI, FORMER NEW YORK MAYOR
utterances.sentences: Don't be ridiculous. Networks don't get to decide elections. Courts do.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Actually, voters decide elections. Trump and his allies would unsuccessfully take their stolen election case to court after court nearly 60 times. But millions of Trump supporters stuck in an echo chamber of right-wing propaganda, news and social media would hear only have more and more allegations of fraud.

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: They know they stole this, and they also know that we're going to show they stole it.O'SULLIVAN:  Will you accept Joe Biden as president?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: No, he'll never be my president.O'SULLIVAN:  I mean, how could that change at this point?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Well, it could be civil war. You never know.JOHN SCOTT-RAILTON, SENIOR RESEARCHER, CITIZEN LAB, UNIVERSITY OF TORONTO:  The news site day-after-day was hit with things that were designed to look as if something bad was happening, claims of fraud, claims of stolen ballots, misleading video and social media platforms played a huge role in rapidly expanding those claims.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Dead people voted, so explain that.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: But where did you get that particular news that dead people were voting?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: It's on multiple sources. I don't have my computer in front of me, so I can't really look it up. I can find it for you.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Just like the other made up election tales you can find on the computer, the dead voting conspiracy isn't true.Trump-appointed Republican election security officials would be called to testify before Congress only to declare Trump really did lose.

utterances.speaker: CHRIS KREBS, FORMER UNITED STATES DIRECTOR OF THE CYBERSECURITY AND INFRASTRUCTURE SECURITY AGENCY
utterances.sentences: This was a secure election. Of that, I have no doubt.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: In no way to I believe it wasn't stolen.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: No way?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Period, no way.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Even though all those people who watch elections --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: They're all bought.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: All of them?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Trump's own attorney general, Bill Barr, said this was a fair election.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yes, to save himself.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Trump would not accept defeat.TIM O'BRIEN, AUTHOR, TRUMPNATION, THE ART OF BEING THE DONALD:  He couldn't take an election loss because Donald Trump wants his gravestone to read, I won. He is preoccupied with this idea that he never loses.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: For Trump supporters, Stop the Steal would be their battle cry. And what began online would take to the streets.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: We were on the Trump train early on.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Amy Kremer's group launched a Facebook page that quickly went viral, and recycling an old tactic from her tea party days would paint a new bus and travel across the country in what she called the March for Trump. UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: It's going to be lit out here at the Stop the Steal, Not the Coup rally.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: And a right-wing activist named Ali Alexander would push his own Stop the Steal movement, staging protest and asking supporters to send him money.

utterances.speaker: REPORTER
utterances.sentences: How much money are you making on all of this?

utterances.speaker: ALI ALEXANDER, STOP THE STEAL MOVEMENT
utterances.sentences: Zero, zero. I'm dedicating my time and my company to it.

utterances.speaker: REPORTER
utterances.sentences: How do we know that with all the money that's go into your finances.

utterances.speaker: ALEXANDER
utterances.sentences: I don't (INAUDIBLE) I'm not doing it.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: The Stop the Steal movements would merge into one major day of protest, December 12th, in Washington D.C. President Trump buzzing the crowd in a helicopter would energize his base for what was coming next.Meanwhile, Donovan Crowl, the out of work alcoholic, had been recruited into the OathKeepers, a paramilitary group that opposes the federal government. Jessica Watkins, who owned this rural bar in Ohio, was the local chapter's leader. Bartender Julie Harvey says she saw the group meet every week.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: They were going to DC for the original Million MAGA March. I was working and I walked out on the patio and I saw them sawing the pool keys and half putting on the zip straps. The way that Jessica explained it was just preparedness in case they were in harm's way.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Who are the Oath Keepers, in your mind, right now based on what you know?

utterances.speaker: ROWE
utterances.sentences: They're a terrorist organization. They're white supremacists.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: You consider your son one?

utterances.speaker: ROWE
utterances.sentences: Yes, I do. I mean, I hate to say that, but yes. It makes me sad to say that. Yes, I do.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: With no realistic prospects of overturning the election in court, Trump plots his coup, focusing on the day Vice President Mike Pence would preside over Congress to confirm Biden's victory, January 6th. Trump also encouraged his supporters to converge on D.C. January 6th, telling them, be there, will be wild.

utterances.speaker: CYR
utterances.sentences: President Trump said come to D.C., it's going to be wild. I've asked you to do things. I've asked you to vote and to go to DC. And I knew it was going to be history. GRIFFIN

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Trump 2020.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I think my sister truly believed that them going there, they were going to change America for the greater.
